newsitem.title: CHINA: China copper prices seen above 22,000 yuan/T in H2.
newsitem.headline: China copper prices seen above 22,000 yuan/T in H2.

text.p: China's domestic spot copper prices are expected to fluctuate between 22,000 yuan ($2,650) and 26,000 yuan per tonne in the second half of 1997, the People's Daily Overseas Edition said on Monday.
Copper prices were expected to have upward potential in the second half because of rising consumption, it quoted a forecast by the China National Metals and Minerals Import and Export Corp as saying.
On the Shanghai Metal Exchange, the October 1997 contract ended at 21,590 yuan ($2,604) per tonne on Monday, up 200 yuan from Friday's close.
An official crackdown on speculation in the stock market would also drive some funds into copper-related production and trading sectors and push up consumption, the newspaper said.
China's copper firms were expected to boost exports to the international market to cash in on higher overseas prices, thus reducing supply in domestic markets, it said.
"Domestic demand is still weak," an official of the China National Metals and Minerals Import and Export Corp said. "Exports remain a profitable business."
